paragraph1.third: following a professional retraining with OpenClassrooms. In just 5 months, I was able to familiarize myself with web practices through

paragraph2.first: Being self-taught, I like to carry out small personal projects to practice my new skills. That's why OpenClassrooms was the ideal solution for me to learn. As a curious perfectionist, I'm
paragraph2.third: both my technical and social skills.

projects.title: Discord bot

infos.description: Development of a basic moderation bot for Discord.

projects.context: With 20 different commands and a database, it performs a few basic moderation actions on a small server.

projects.title: Booki

infos.description: This is OpenClassrooms' first project. It provides an opportunity to discover web tools and practices through a mock-up project. The mock-up is created in HTML and CSS using Figma.

projects.context: Booki is a start-up that wants to develop a website enabling users to find accommodation and activities in the city of their choice. Sarah, the CTO prepared a base for me to complete with the mock-up elements prepared by Loïc, the UI designer.Sarah entrusted me with the task of integrating the site's interface in HTML and CSS into a web mock-up, while preserving the given structure.

projects.title: Sophie Bluel

infos.description: This is OpenClassrooms' second project. It teaches us how to make a web page dynamic using JavaScript. We were provided with a backend and a base for the frontend, a mock-up on Figma to respect, and a Kanban under Notion.

projects.context: I am a front-end developer for ArchiWebos. Having finished the last project with a little bit of advance, I'm called to reinforce the creation of the portfolio site of an interior architect.

projects.title: Menu Maker by Qwenta
projects.coveralt: Menu Maker by Qwenta website banner

infos.description: This is OpenClassrooms' third project. We have to propose an organization for the realization of the technical solution: implementation of a technical watch tool, a project management tool and to realize a Kanban, drafting of technical specifications.

projects.context: I'm a front-end developer at Webgencia. I've been given a mission that's a little different from the usual one. It's not about developing a site, but about leading, preparing and planning a site development project.

projects.title: Nina Carducci - Photographie
projects.coveralt: Banner featuring a photo of a wedding. It reads: Nina Carducci, photographie

infos.description: This is OpenClassrooms' fourth project. We were asked to optimize a site after carrying out an audit. After the audit, a report is drawn up for presentation to the client.

projects.context: As a freelance developer, I audited Nina's website and offered to optimize it. Nina responded favorably to my request. We agreed on several services: global optimization, SEO, local referencing, metas for social networks, accessibility and finally a report presenting all this.

projects.title: Kasa
projects.coveralt: Image of a hotel room with the Kasa logo.

infos.description: This is OpenClassrooms' fifth project. It's a project for the complete redesign of a real estate rental site, which introduces us to ReactJS, where we have to build all the components.

projects.context: Kasa has been in the apartment rental business for almost 10 years now. Laura, the CTO, has launched a total redesign to move to a full JavaScript stack with NodeJS on the back-end, and React on the front-end. Kasa is recruiting me as a freelance front-end developer to develop its new web platform.

projects.title: Mon Vieux Grimoire

infos.description: This is OpenClassrooms' sixth project. We're building the site's backend in NoSQL with MongoDB in JavaScript.

projects.context: I've been a freelance back-end developer in the Lille area for a year now. I often work with Kévin, a more experienced front-end developer. He contacted me to work with him on a book referencing and rating site.

projects.title: Portfolio

infos.description: This is OpenClassrooms' seventh and final project. We need to develop and publish our portfolio, where we can showcase our work and projects.

projects.context: I create and publish my portfolio to showcase my work with a view to finding a job.

softskills.title: Project management
softskills.subtitle: Propose and organize the implementation of the technical solution

softskills.title: Website optimization
softskills.subtitle: Audit and intervention to optimize the site to current standards, W3C validation and natural SEO referencing

softskills.title: JavaScript backend creation
softskills.subtitle: Communication between the site and a database

softskills.title: Multi-platform production
softskills.subtitle: Compatible with all PC, tablet and mobile devices
